results.description: Come join TNT for an hour and a half of tennis skills, drills and some fun games in Brentwood. Advanced players can improve their game and learn new techniques with a certified USPTA Elite Professional Instructor at a private facility with parking, $20 per person (3 person minimum). Please be sure to be a strong 3.5-4.0. You must be able to consistently hit topspin, slice and volleys otherwise I suggest you sign up for the advanced beginner clinics. If only 2 can come then we'll do an hour. Check with me if there is rain or bad weather. Email or text (615-349-5889) me with any questions.
results.name: Advanced drills n' skills w/pro in Brentwood

results.description:
This is an easy in town cruise of 10-12 miles for all types of riders. Helmets required, lights recommended, cancelled if the roads are wet. We don't leave anyone behind.

IF the ride is cancelled due to rain, this will be posted here at about 5 pm Wed. See you soon!
results.name: Wednesday Night Friendly Ride

results.description:
See downtown Nashville and its landmarks on foot and up close! Our weekly urban hikes have become a popular trek for beginners and expert hikers alike. This is a wonderful opportunity for first-time visitors to see Music City.

Departure Time @ Thai Phooket: 6:30 p.m. SHARP (unless we have a good reason to wait)

Distance: 5.2 miles

Hike Time: 2 hours

Rating: Moderate

Join us for a walk from Thai Phooket, past LP Field, over the Cumberland River, through Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park, into Germantown, back through Bicentennial Mall, past the State Capitol (via 240 steps), through downtown, past the Schermerhorn Symphony Center, across the Cumberland River via the Shelby Avenue Pedestrian Bridge, once again past LP Field, then back to Thai Phooket.

This "hike" is for beginners and experienced hikers, alike. Feel comfortable walking fast or slow. We'll try to stay together, but when the group gets large enough, we often split into two (or more) groups with an experienced member "sweeping" the trail. We'll try not to lose anybody, but please call me if you get lost. We do this for fellowship, exercise, and fun. It's not a race! The hike pauses at selected locations, so we may regroup and permit those who need a rest, time to catch their breath. The hike resumes when I am comfortable that everyone is ready. This also helps assure that we don't lose anyone along the way.

All are welcome to stay and enjoy a great post-hike Thai dinner. I think it's best Thai food in Nashville.

Dress for the weather, wear comfortable footwear, and bring some water as necessary. See downtown Nashville up close, stop the world from spinning in Bicentennial Mall, and ring the State Capitol Liberty Bell (while avoiding capitol police).

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

LOCATION DETAILS:

Thai Phooket: 207 Woodland Street, Nashville, TN 37213

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

MISCELLANEOUS:

Questions? Call or text Preston @[masked]

Running late? Please call or text Preston, but please don't text and drive.

Can't make it? Please be courteous and change your RSVP as early as possible!

Posted times are departure times. We will leave on time unless we have a compelling reason to wait a few minutes longer.
results.how_to_find_us: West corner (toward downtown) of the building. We become obvious as more gather.
results.name: Urban Hike - 5Â¼ Mile Night Walk - Downtown Nashville - Great for New Members!

results.description:
Please note that the start time is now set for 6:30 pm to allow it to cool off a little on these hot summer days.

Join us for pickup mixed doubles at McGavock High School (Two Rivers Park).

results.description:
It''s about time to get back into shape, so please join me on this 2.5 mile night hike. This is a great beginner hike, so if you have been thinking about hiking, but haven't had a chance to ease into it, or don't want to do it alone, now is your chance!

STATS: We will start at the Nature Center and follow the "Blue" trail up and around the "hill." the hike is around 2.5 (not an exact length) and should take around 1 hour at a moderate pace.

There is always the possibility that we will go out for a bight to eat afterwards, so bring an dry shirt. : )

Please be sure to wear good shoes, as there may be mud and or slippery rocks in some areas.

Also, bring a Head lamp or flashlight and plenty of water!

***Well Behaved Dogs Welcome, and MUST BE ON A LEASH-NO EXCEPTIONS!"
results.how_to_find_us: We will be standing in front of the Nature Center, (by the restrooms)
results.name: 2.5 mile Beginners Night Hike @ Edwin Warner Park (Blue Trail)

results.description: Please bring one dark shirt and one white shirt. If you have a ball and/or PUGGs, please bring them as well. The more equipment we have, the easier it is to avoid crowded games.

venue.name: Percy Warner Park - Bob Brown Field House

results.description:
A great hike for beginners on a moderate trail that gives a chance to try out gear and gumption while covering ~5.5 miles (~2000' of rise/fall) of reasonably groomed trails lined with some wildlife and plush woods.

If you're interested, sign up & let's meet up for a lap of Percy Warner's Mossy Ridge and chase the sun out of the park. Plan on meeting Thursdays at 6:30pm and heading to the trail no later than 6:45pm.

Rain or shine?:

Hike takes place year round in all conditions (save for high risk (windy) weather - the trail does have a lot of widow makers lurking on it).

How long does it last?:

Hike lasts around two hours (a little less on cooler nights, a bit longer on hotter nights).

Where do we meet?:

We will start from the "Cross Country" parking lot off of Highway 100 (just east of the junction at Old Hickory, picture of the parking lot below)

by the Bob Brown Field House and take the Candy Cane Connector to the Mossy Ridge trail. Depending on the group's preference, we may proceed clockwise or counter-clockwise (some feel counter-clockwise is easier) for a little variety on the Mossy Ridge trail.

Should a cross country meet be in play at the park, plan on meeting back by the Bob Brown Field house (vs. the parking lot) to make it easier to find the group & start on time.

On nights when the hike finishes at a reasonable time, we will often head to the Brewhouse 100 or Sportsman's for a little camaraderie & grub before heading home.

What do you need?:

Light(s) required to finish the hike out and ensure your safety.

Recommend carrying water as the summer nights are still quite warm well into the night.

If rain was/is in the forecast, gaiters are handy to keep mud & muck out of your boots or shoes. A light weight shell is also handy to carry if weather looks iffy.

For summer hikes, dress accordingly to vent and stay cool. Opt for synthetics over cotton to help keep yourself from being soaked and having trouble cooling.

For winter hikes, dress accordingly to vent and stay warm. The key to temperature control is staying dry, so bear that in mind as you select your layers.

Hiking boots or shoes recommended as numerous rocky areas, scree, and roots are present on the trail. So treat your feet as you see fit for comfort and safety bearing that in mind.


Bug spray highly recommended in the summer/fall months.


Poles are a personal preference thing, never use mine unless it is super slick/icy or if I twist an ankle. However, if you are prone to doing your own stunts, I'd recommend using them to provide a bit of stability.

FRS radios are welcome, default to channel 1/1 for general monitoring/use. Alternate channel is usually 7/11 for convenience. Try to keep banter to a minimum though, and let the wildlife wander peacefully.

Dogs are welcome to come along, but must be on a leash. It's the law and snakes frequent the trail. Don't risk putting your furry friend in harm's way...

The past several years have witnessed yellow jacket nests within proximity of or on the trail. If you are allergic to bee stings, please make it known to the group and travel prepared.
results.how_to_find_us: Park at the "Cross Country Parking Lot" by the Bob Brown Field House just past OHB heading towards Belle Meade on HWY100. Link in details below.
results.name: Night hikes on Mossy Ridge (Red Trail) in Percy Warner Park.

results.description:
Hello players, We are restarting our indoor game every Thursday at Shelby Community Center(East Nashville). * Game Format: 5 vs 5 , 3-Teams, 1 or 2-Subs/team * Organizer will assign you to a team with the intent of balancing skill and keeping it competetive. * The organizer will also assign a captain to each team and he or she is RESPONSIBLE for smooth transition of subs: each player will be given a number and rotate according to that sequence.

RSVP
Up to 7 days in advance

LATE CANCEL & NO SHOW
You will not be allowed to play the following 2 weeks. We have a very lenient late cancel policy (2 hours) so simply no contention, no excuse please whether there were spaces left or not!

ETIQUETTE

1. Refrain from excessive coaching during the game.
2. Refrain from excessive use of foul language.
3. No fighting, of course.

LOCAL GAME RULES:
1. No Side & End Line! (This makes for free flowing game)
2. All kick-offs (initial or following a goal) must be taken from the center mark.
3. Sliding is allowed only near a goal area to protect it, but sliding tackles are not allowed at all.

Thank you,
Babatunde/organizer
results.name: Indoor Soccer at Shelby

results.description:
Yep. I've been struggling as a Meetup organizer this year but the Red Sox are still on track! Three weeks to go until the playoff teams are solidified and only 3 games separate first through fourth... Nothing is decided. Join us down at Batter'd and Fried for Game 2 of a 4 game set against the New York Yankees. Meet some new folks and see some familiar faces as we gear up for another critical run into October. Eat, drink, laugh, and cheer on the boys from Beantown as they beat up on some pinstripes!

Same as always - show whenever, bring whoever, leave whenever.
results.name: Sox vs. Yankees - The Run for October...

group.name: The Middle TN Red Sox Nation Meetup Group

results.description:
LOL...wouldn't this be amazing...

WHAT: Join several of your friends for an unforgettable evening of pure Relaxation on one of our fave island...for this evening...You bring your fave food to grill and a small side to share and of course your fave beverage of choice.

After our "potluck" we will simply relax perhaps with a moonlight swim.....we will then paddle over to Shipwreck Cove at Elm Hill Marina for some live music...

If you need Kayaking gear simply say gear please on your rsvp, a small donation of $15pp is appreciated....I do not have enough lights for everyone, so please bring a flashlight or two also ziploc bags to keep them dry.

Feel free to email me with any questions you may have...
results.name: Full Moon Paddle, BBQ and Live Music

results.description:
We are BACK for the 39th rolling of the FBC, and we are teaming up with Nashville Bike Party for the ultimate night-riding cruise on two (**or three if you have a recumbent**) wheels. The theme is WEREWOLVES VS. FARMERS so some have suggested plaid, or furry facial hair. Take your pick!

FBCers and East Siders, you are welcome to join us to leave from Five Points (parking lot beside Eastside Cycles) at 6:15pm to get over to the Parthenon to roll at 7pm with the Bike Party. If you want to just meet at the Parthenon, that's fine too! Departure at 7p sharpish from the Parthenon!

Bike Party event RSVP on Facebook is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1777525549194016/

21+, bring LIGHTS, 15ish miles round trip for this one (if you start from the East Side with us). Not a ride for the fastest, so slow your roll and cruise along with us.


More info at www.fbcnashville.com or on Twitter @fbcnash. We're also on Facebook at Full Moon Nashville if you're into that sort of thing.

Destination location for this ride is The Crying Wolf, and will be an A-to-B ride for this special occasion. We roll whatever the weather; rides can range from between 6-10 miles round trip and include opportunity for beveraging at the destination location. Casual ride, novice to expert bike riders welcome, be 21+, bring lights, ***bring ID***. We only have one rule. Yes, this being Nashville, there may be hills along the route.

Facebook event invite, if you want to share there, is https://www.facebook.com/events/1174210369269152/</a><a href="https://www.facebook.com/events/1248350078514857">
results.how_to_find_us: look for the friendly bike riding people with lots of lights
results.name: FBC #39 Full Harvest Moon & Nashville Bike Party

results.description:
Meeting Time: 7:30 PM
Meeting Place: Picnic shelter 9
Hike Distance: 4.25 miles
Estimated Hike Time: Under 2 hours
Difficulty: Easy, paved trails (strollers allowed)
Hike Leader: Michael Hughes of Merrell Nashville & Tread Light Adventure Travel
Kids and leashed dogs are welcomed

See the woods through a full-moon glow. Meet at Edwin Warner Park picnic site #9, off Vaughn Road â across from the model airplane field. Bring your flashlight or headlamp, water and walking shoes.

Since 2001, Michael Hughes has been leading the Full Moon Hikes at Warner Parks where he's hosted as few as two and as many as 100+ hiking lovers. Join us for this lunar spectacle each month!

We're looking for volunteers who've done this hike before to run sweep; basically take up the end of the line and make sure everyone finishes without getting lost. Let us know in your comments or tell Michael when you arrive.

https://youtu.be/fDj3G4Sm7z4
results.how_to_find_us: From Old Hickory Blvd at the Steeplechase grounds, turn at the light onto Vaughn Road. Turn right into the picnic grounds, just beyond the dog park. Follow the road to the back. Site #9 is just beyond the left turn near the open field.

results.description:
Join us for a trip down the upper Duck River from Dement Bridge...this will 7.5 miles float...

Driving time to the put in is about 45 minutes from Murfreesboro.

This is a beautiful section of the upper Duck River with interesting rock bluffs, shaded gravel bars, good swimming holes and even a nice chute that we all can float down.


This section is suitable for all levels of paddlers.

Remember to bring your safety gear, lunch, sunblock and water...BBQ riverside...yeehaaaa...

WATER GUNS....A MUST....

We'll meet at the Cracker Barrel on I24 East at The Sam Ridley Parkway exit in Smyrna at 7:00 am.

If you want breakfast come earlier but we will leave for the put in at 8:00am,,,7:00 am for breakfast...

Kayak will be available for a donation of $30ea...
results.name: Upper Duck River : Dement Bridge to Hwy 41 Bridge...ENCORE

results.description:
Join us at Beaman Park for a hike along the quiet and uncrowded trails of this wooded 1500 acre park.

We will meet in front of the Nature Center off Old Hickory Blvd between Clarksville Hwy and Ashland City Hwy (use map link below).


The hike takes us downhill on the Sedge Hill Trail, across the creek to the Henry Hollow Loop, along the Creekside Trail, uphill on the Ridgetop Trail, then back (taking the other half of the Henry Hollow Loop), for a total of 6.6 miles.

These trails are rated moderate and the hike should be easily completed in less than 3 hours.This hike will be at a brisk pace.


Wear appropriate footwear, bring a snack, and plenty of water.

Google Map to Nature Center: http://maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geocode=&q=5911+Old+Hickory+Boulevard,+Ashland+City,+TN&aq=0&oq=5911+Old+Hickory+Blvd,+Ashland,+tn&sll=36.273549,-86.87866&amp...

Beaman Park Trail Map: http://www.nashville.gov/parks/docs/trails/MapBeamanPark.pdf
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be standing around in the parking lot. :-)
results.name: Beaman Park 6.6 Mile Hike

results.name: Pickup doubles (3.5 - 4.5) at Glencliff High School

results.description:
http://youtu.be/hjiTxMzvC7s

Join your hiking---and rock hopper---mates for a day of trails, rocks, frolic and fun ROCK ISLAND STATE PARK. And cliff jumping??? Just kidding. No, not really kidding. If water conditions are right, then you will have the chance to cliff dive off Giant Falls.

Check out the video from 2013 summer's trip here: MrRogueLeader12 video

Cliff Diving starts about minute 3 into the video.

QUICK FACTS:

Depart Time CARPOOL #1: 8:30 am (CT) Steak 'n' Shake in Antioch, off I-24 Exit #59.

Depart TimeCARPOOL #2: 9:05 am (CDT): Burger King in Murfreesboro, off I-24 Exit #81-A.

HIKE DISTANCE: Approximately 5-7 miles. Hiker Minimum: 4 / Maximum 17.

Rating Scale:


1-3: Take the Kids

4-6: Take your Time, Take water shoes plus hike shoes

7-8: Take a Map & Rescue Beacon

9-10: Take Bear Grylls

DIFFICULTY RATING: 6 to 7. Moderate to Difficult. There will be "rock hopping" and scrambling involved which may require balance with your hands. Thus, the difficulty rating goes up a notch. Expect to get wet on this trip, and even completely immersed if you choose. That's part of the fun!!!

DRIVE TIME: 1 HR 10 MIN one way from the Murfreesboro carpool.


Directions from Murfreesboro carpool :

Rock Island Market

1231 Rock Island Rd, Rock Island, TN 38581

The carpool(s) should arrive at the Rock Island Market about 10:20ish am (CDT).

We will convene at the Rock Island Market to re-group between carpoolers and non-carpoolers. I've included links to maps for directions. We will then drive over to the Gorge Parking Lot off Power House Rd to hit the Caney Fork area.

ACTUAL HIKE+Cliff Dive TIME: ~6 Hours.


HIKING PLAN: Falls Loop Trail plus "rocky shoreline", a trip through the Rock Island Riviera, and 30 foot cliff jumps from Giant Falls---if water conditions allow.

WHY SHOULD I GO? The area in, on, and around Twin Falls is a popular picture taking spot. Bring your camera. The loop trail reaches a beach area, and from this point we WILL definitely hike along the rock strewn shore line of the Caney Fork River. Possibly half or more of the whole trip will be spent on the rocks. Refer to the pictures---taken from a recent Rock Island adventure---attached here for an idea of the rocky terrain.

Also, if you want to jump off a 30-foot cliff...here's your chance.

If you are not confident in your ability to find your footing and to balance yourself on small and large boulders, then please do not sign up for this trip. If this picture makes you nervous, then consider carefully your RSVP.

FINAL NOTES:

Bring water and snacks. We'll break occasionally and stop a little longer for "lunch"

Please RSVP with integrity. If you sign up, then learn you cannot make it, please log on to the website and change your RSVP to "can't go".

Be sure to offer your carpool driver a minimum of $12 cash for gas and vehicle usage. Price is $1.95/gallon average as of August 21, 2016.

Post-Hike optional group grub grab in Manchester, TN.
results.name: The Rock. In/Out of H2O Trails. Option: Cliff Dive, mark off your Bucket List.

results.description:
HIKE STATS:
Meeting Place and Time: Trailhead at West Parking Lot Visitor Center entrance if you are coming from Granny White (at 8:30 a.m. for a 8:45 departure). If you choose to come from the Franklin Road side, you can join us at the East Parking Lot at 9:30 a.m.
Hike Distance: up to 5 miles
Estimated Hike Time: max 2 hours
Event Leader: Hassan (mobile[masked])
Rating: Moderate

We'll start at the Granny White Pike entrance West parking lot, hike to Ganier Ridge and East Parking Lot for a quick break, then continue to South Cove Trail and back to West parking area. Pets are not allowed on the trails.

Note that on good weather days Radnor parking can get crowded. Please allow plenty of travel time and observe all traffic flow and parking rules posted.

There is not a sign for Radnor Lake on Granny White Pike or Franklin Road. Look on the map for where Otter Creek Road intersects Granny White Pike or Franklin Road and turn there.

results.description:
Join us for our Fitness OnBoard Classes as they move outside until October

A Fast paced classed designed to get you in shape "boot camp" style! A great way to take your favorite work out to a new environment. Experience high intensity , full body work outs that target strength, cardio, flexibility, core and muscle endurance on a paddle board. This class is open to anyone and everyone, whether it's you first time on a paddle board or your 100th.

Reservations must be made at <a>www.paddleupnashville.com or</a>

<a> Book Now!</a>

Note: RSVPs on Meet Up will not guarantee a reservation.

Class is $20 (when RSVP online)
$25 walk-ins

Arrive 15 minutes early to get signed in and set up, class starts promptly at 10:30
results.how_to_find_us: www.paddleupnashville.com
results.name: OnBoard Fitness Class at Paddle Up Nashville

group.name: Stand Up Paddle Boarding in Nashville TN.

results.description:
Come out for a hike at beautiful Radnor Lake.


Meeting Place: Bike rack at the Nature Center at the Granny White Pike entrance to the park
Hike Distance: We usually do both ridges, about 4.5 miles. You can also break off and do a shorter hike if you like.
Estimated Hike Time: up to 2 hours
Difficulty: Moderate Terrain / Brisk Pace (only a few short rest breaks)

1. DO NOT enter Radnor Lake from the Franklin Road side. Because the road is blocked to vehicle traffic through the park, you must enter from Granny White Pike/Otter Creek Road - on maps, Otter Creek Road looks like a through street for cars, but it is not.


2. There are no signs for Radnor Lake on Granny White Pike - look on the map for where Otter Creek Road intersects Granny White Pike and turn there.


3. Pets are not allowed on the trails. Please observe traffic flow and parking rules.


4. You can reach me (Tim) at[masked] (cell).

** If 3 or less rsvps or if raining the hike is considered canceled. You can still hike if you like.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bike rack at the Nature Center
results.name: Radnor Lake Hike 9/19 5:00 PM

results.description:
Hello players, We are restarting our indoor game every Tuesday at Shelby Community Center(East Nashville). * Game Format: 5 vs 5 , 3-Teams, 1 or 2-Subs/team * Organizer will assign you to a team with the intent of balancing skill and keeping it competetive. * The organizer will also assign a captain to each team and he or she is RESPONSIBLE for smooth transition of subs: each player will be given a number and rotate according to that sequence.

RSVP
Up to 7 days in advance

LATE CANCEL & NO SHOW
You will not be allowed to play the following 2 weeks. We have a very lenient late cancel policy so simply no contention, no excuse please whether there were spaces left or not!

ETIQUETTE

1. Refrain from excessive coaching during the game.
2. Refrain from excessive use of foul language.
3. No fighting, of course.

LOCAL GAME RULES:
1. No Side & End Line! (This makes for free flowing game)
2. All kick-offs (initial or following a goal) must be taken from the center mark.
3. Sliding is allowed only near a goal area to protect it, but sliding tackles are not allowed at all.

Thank you,
Babatunde/organizer
results.name: Indoor Soccer at Shelby

results.description:
Note that the start time has been changed to 6:30 pm to allow it to cool off a little before starting.

I've just changed the number of RSVPs available to reflect the fact that only 3 of the courts are available at Hillwood right now, as the other 3 are being resurfaced.

Come on out and join us at the Hillwood High School tennis courts for pick-up mixed doubles. Players at several different levels usually show up, so it is a great time for Advanced Beginners or Intermediates to get in some playing time.


If you are completely new to tennis, you may want to take a few beginning tennis clinics from Ken or Ty, or from another source (there are loads of places to get beginning instruction) before signing up for this meetup.
results.name: Tuesday Tennis at Hillwood

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
